[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/bytecode.rs] [Function: downgrade_to_v6()] [Logic Error] If bytecode version is exactly VERSION_6, does the early return prevent unnecessary processing, or could there be a case where VERSION_6 bytecode still needs transformation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/bytecode.rs] [Function: downgrade_to_v6()] [Error Message Leakage] Does the error_explanation() function expose internal file paths or system information that could aid attackers in reconnaissance? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/bytecode.rs] [Function: execute()] [Insecure Permissions] Does write_to_user_only_file() ensure that output files have restrictive permissions (0600), or could disassembled/decompiled Move code be readable by other users? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/bytecode.rs] [Function: execute()] [Directory Creation] Does create_dir_if_not_exist() create directories with secure permissions, or could intermediate directories be world-writable? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/bytecode.rs] [Function: execute()] [File Overwrite] Can an attacker bypass the check_if_file_exists() prompt by using PromptOptions to automatically overwrite critical files without user consent? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/bytecode.rs] [Function: execute()] [Extension Bypass] Can an attacker provide a file with multiple extensions (e.g., 'malicious.mv.exe') that passes the MOVE_COMPILED_EXTENSION check but causes security issues in downstream processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/bytecode.rs] [Function: execute()] [Case Sensitivity] On case-insensitive filesystems, can an attacker use '.MV' or '.Mv' extensions to bypass the extension validation check? (Low)
